bibl.title: Letter from the secretary of Philip Showalter Hench to Blossom Reed, August 12, 1953

div1.p: Hench's secretary informs Blossom Reed that Hench has made more attempts to get a good price for her father's books but has been unsuccessful. He will buy them himself for $10 per volume if he is unable to find a better offer.

div1.head: Letter from the secretary of Philip Showalter Hench to Blossom Reed, August 12, 1953
div1.opener:
yellow
fever
August 12, 1953
Mrs. Blossom Reed
Blue Ridge Summit
Pennsylvania
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Doctor Hench has made two or three more attempts
which were not successful and which have dis-
appointed him greatly. He has not by any means
exhausted the possibilities but he has been working
very hard and intends to buy the books himself
at the price of $10 per volume (which is the
price which the Benjamin people offered first
and later changed) if he is unable to get a
better price.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Secretary to
Doctor Hench alc
